It's about setting goals out of your own creative mind. If you want a challenge set one.

  • Free the end
  • Complete all advancements
  • Win a raid
  • Make mob farms
  • Join a server and try to get to a certain level

Some of those systems hardware just can't take it I would assume.  Similar to how there's a Minecraft *New* 3DS version, but not for the original 3DS hardware.
If you would like to share your opinions on this feel free to post a comment!

Yes I would love to see the Legacy console edition again as I grew up playing the console editions and their quirks and odities and the manny features that have been all but lost to micorsoft. They need to make a cheeper version of minecraft that is a direct port of the legacy console edition and sell it of like £5. There was so much nostalga in the console edition with its tutorial world, mini games, mashup packs, and 1st party texture packs.
plz do cause i have a mac and i cant play with my friends on windows 10
Hmm… while yes, Minecraft should be moved to more platforms, Bedrock is Microsoft-influenced. I think that Microsoft wouldn’t allow it, due to competition, however this is an extremely good idea.
100% agree - losing accessibility to bedrock because of macOS is extremely annoying for someone who doesn't own a console. Like it's 2022, why isn't this already available?

This is needed very much so. 
If not MacOS version of Bedrock, at least allow the iOS(iPadOS) version to be installed via the MacOS AppStore onto the Mac. It should run fairly decently, and you can just easily post a disclaimer that
"MacOS running the iOS or iPadOS versions of the game is not fully supported" and then allow users to install it anyways after agreeing to the fact it isn't a supported platform (yet)

Feedback item with previous votes for Bedrock on MacOS
https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360076576331-Bedrock-edition-for-MacOS-
I agree! It also should be available for Linux.
Yes, please release Minecraft Bedrock Edition for macOS, at least for Apple Silicon chips (M1, M2, etc.).
I would love this!

Yes please! I really want to download the original Minecraft: Nintendo Switch Edition! I unfortunately didn't get the chance to download it, and instead could only download Bedrock. The Bedrock version is okay, but I miss the classic Edition version and really want to redownload it and play it again. I think it's fair to bring it back since Java Edition let's us play the older versions of Minecraft in addition to the newest version!

Is there a way to still download old Pocket Edition anywhere? My son doesn't like changes and transitions. He loves Minecraft but really misses the old PE. It is what got him into Minecraft and he loved the look of everything in it. His device was ruined with old edition and we can't find a way to get it for him. He is really frustrated. He doesn't like the updates and changes. I hope someone can help us. I think it should be available somehow because I have read many posts that people preferred it. Thank you!

I agree with this. The new updates for minecraft have just gotten worse and worse and I would really love to play the old version again. I miss playing minecraft but I get so frustrated while playing with all of the new updates that I dont even understand.
they could make it a legacy edition like what they did for the consoles

Yeah nice, I was thinking of introducing the old pocket edition on raspberry pie! The old pocket edition is fun and cool and has small storage. Here is my post about pocket edition on raspberry pie, I also think that the raspberry pie and old pocket edition should be cross platform https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360071887431-Small-update-adding-Classic-pocket-edition-features-to-raspberry-pie-

Try Minecraft Pi on the Raspberry Pi 4. It works the same. There is also a Google Play app that I DO NOT ADVOCATE FOR called "Block Sun Earth," which I have confirmed after testing is a direct copy of the source code from pocket edition with a new set of textures. It should and probably will be taken down, since it is pretty much the definition of piracy, but it has more or less what you want.
